channel.title: Thoughts on Duma's website
channel.description: Recent content in Thoughts on Duma's website

item.title: Maybe it's not technology
item.description: Wrong direction I had the opportunity to work for many small and medium companies. Most of them weren’t software house. Most of them weren’t up to date with all the technologies of javascript’s world. Typescript, Angular, and React were like echoes of distant mermaids: attractive yet too far to make the boat change direction. I think that, startups excluded, most companies still fall under this description today. Their softwares are “old” web application written in javascript v5, jQuery and, God forbid, Bootstrap 3.
